Traffic Separation Scheme (TSS) - Applicable in proximity to designated maritime lanes - Spatial Anchor: Near unnamed traffic separation scheme
Operational Protocol Rationale: The vessel is navigating a gently curving route with stable speed and minimal heading variation, which is typical when following a defined channel within a traffic separation scheme. This behavior ensures safe, predictable movement through constrained waters where vessels must maintain alignment with designated traffic flows and execute smooth turns to avoid conflicts. The consistent course progression and steady propulsion indicate adherence to navigational protocols for structured waterways, ruling out anchoring, maneuvering, or erratic transit.
